Description of incident: An employee responsible for moving patients around Provena Covenant was sentenced to eight years in federal prison for identity theft.  The former employee accessed patient names, Social Security numbers, dates of birth and other personal information by stealing patient wallets and through other methods.  She also used at least one patient's credit card information to pay for access to victims outside of Provena Covenant.  At least 100 different names were found at the woman's home.  It is not clear if all of those names were related to the former employee's misdeeds at Provena Covenant between 2007 and 2008.
